# Polygon has point

## Usage
```js
const { pointInPolygon } = require('polygon-has-point');

const polygon = [
    [56.22259136217699, 58.01036084201374],
    [56.21277405231421, 58.011191431146344],
    [56.23157097309056, 58.00424359915331],
    [56.24343767667414, 58.00797785380106],
    [56.244467644935874, 58.01460610439242],
    [56.22773066068293, 58.015426008504434],
    [56.21266737485529, 58.01116685669082],
    [56.23373880887631, 58.00939016169297],
    [56.23705383318532, 58.0091080251409],
    [56.23756881731616, 58.013344646730026],
    [56.23104568499194, 58.014665640815664],
    [56.226797065912336, 58.01389127090936],
    [56.225252113519765, 58.01197804961148],
    [56.22259136217699, 58.01036084201374],
];

console.log(pointInPolygon([56.22227540601961, 58.01198232429825], polygon)); // true
console.log(pointInPolygon([56.23085847486836, 58.012574523308615], polygon)); // false
```
